title: Public Health Clinic
cleaned_text: The Public Health Clinic focuses on protecting individuals and the community from the spread of communicable diseases through the availability of immunizations and tuberculosis testing to the public. Please call to inquire about eligibility and pricing. Unfortunately, we do not bill insurance for vaccination or testing services. |Upcoming Events| |Clinic Schedule| Immunizations 1st and 3rd Tuesday of the month from 9:00 am - 11:30 am and 1:30 pm - 3:30 pm Tuberculosis (TB) Testing - At cost 1st and 3rd Tuesday of the month from 9:00 am - 11:30 am and 1:30 pm - 3:30 pm Tuberculosis (TB) Readings Readings are on the 1st and 3rd Thursday of the month at or after the time your test was placed. (If you miss this reading time, your test will need to be repeated.) |Vaccines Available| Available COVID-19 Vaccines (Ages 6 mo+) - FREE The [FDA authorized](https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/coronavirus-covid-19-update-fda-authorizes-changes-simplify-use-bivalent-mrna-covid-19-vaccines#msdynttrid=dI1dY9xlM2PbpzdTrdaAvZWoLxtCYQ1A_bjQZnegASI) and [CDC recommended](https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2023/s0419-covid-vaccines.html#msdynttrid=Zs5H-yFzLozWJWH-fBd-Q3Na-hnEwQk9OCHUj31CQAI) the use of Moderna and Pfizer Bivalent COVID-19 vaccine for primary series use for individuals 6 months and older. Additional doses of these vaccines for certain populations. Current Moderna and Pfizer Bivalent Vaccine Recommendations: Individuals ages 6 years and older who have already received an updated (bivalent) mRNA vaccine do not need to take any action unless they are 65 years or older or immunocompromised. CDC's new recommendations allow an additional updated (bivalent) vaccine dose for adults ages 65 years and older and additional doses for people who are immunocompromised. CDC recommends that everyone ages 6 years and older receive an updated (bivalent) mRNA COVID-19 vaccine, regardless of whether they previously completed their (monovalent) primary series. For young children, multiple doses continue to be recommended and will vary by age, vaccine, and which vaccines were previously received.No Longer Available Monovalent Pfizer and Moderna vaccines are no longer authorized by FDA or recommended by CDC for use in the United States. Moderna and Pfizer Bivalent COVID-19 vaccine are now used for primary series. We recommend that parents check with their child's primary care provider first for COVID-19 vaccines. Open Door - Del Norte Community Health Center, United Indian Health Services (UIHS), and Sutter Coast Community Clinic all offer COVID-19 vaccines for their patients. Available Adult Vaccines Available Child Vaccines Must be under 19 years old AND one of the following: If your child has a primary care provider, your child should see their primary care provider for immunizations. If your child does not have a primary care provider they see regularly, please make an appointment to speak with our Immunization Coordinator who can connect you with a provider.
